column11: Review Text

column8: Cool and relax place to spend without any noice or disturbances for your real vacation
column11: Beautiful nature scenes could find Adventures riding with tuktuk or jeeps Separate culture and different climate among others

Our tour guide suggested we go to this place. He kept on praising how good the place was. The drive from Kandy was long and the dirt road not comfortable. The last couple of miles we had to get on tuk tuks for which we had to pay. All I can say the ride was adventurous and the drivers kept stopping and picking plants and grass and telling us what they were - black pepper, lemon grass and lots of herbs and spices. Entrance as always was higher for foreigners. There was clean toilet which was welcome. The tuk tuk driver dropped us at the lake.  We walked round which took about 30  minutes but we did  not go all round.  Lots of opportunity to take nice photos with tea plants all along the path. I believe there is tea plantation here as you can see the plantations all round. There was a group of school kids on a day trip. There was an option of a zip line though did not see anyone using it. Boats could be hired on the lake. Overall,  not sure it was worth the detour.

We went there 11/12/25 and didn‚Äôt impressed at all. Initially road condition to get there was terrible?, if you travelling with a smaller car you won‚Äôt get there. Once we get to the tea factory had to leave our car and walk another 700m to get to the top. Otherwise need to hire a tuk tuk which would cost more. Ticket price was too high compared to other places in Sri Lanka yet no proper facilities were established and this place just a tea plantation with a lake in the top of hill, IMO. Once you get to the lake you have to pay more for subsequent activities like Kayak rides or boat rides, not sure why buying a ticket at the counter. You could visit many other places in Sri Lanka which easily accessible with and better facilities and more unique natural beauty.
Such a serene view. We enjoyed the tour so much. Special thanks to Mr Yoga, the three wheel driver who guided us to sembuwatta. Simply wow
It is very important to renovate the Road, very difficult to reach the location. Tuk tuk is available even though they finds difficult to drive. If expecting more visitors, Road should renovated.

Absolutely beautiful! The setting is very beautiful, it is quiet. There is a small restaurant, a "natural" swimming pool Be careful though, the road is chaotic for the last 4 kilometers. Take half an hour to make this 4 km. You have to be careful for those who ride in tuktuk! Price of 1500 rupees for tourists

column8: Access Road and the Tuk Drivers
column11: Sembuwatta Lake is so beautiful and it was more than we expected. This is not about the destination but about the ride from the main road to the lake. There are tuk drivers on the main road and they stopped us and convinced us and our driver saying that the road is so damaged that our vehicle (KDH high roof) can not go. They forced us to hire their tuks to go the lake which they asked 2,500 LKR per one for a distance of 5km. This is so unfair. Our drivers also was frightened after listening to them and we had to accept that tuk drivers and go with them. Also there were some good conditioned vehicles who had parked the vehicles on the main road and took tuks to go up. But I recommend future travellers to not to hire the tuks there because the road was reasonably okay to travel by your bike, car, van at least 4km. If you cant go beyond that you can easily park your vehicle and walk rather than giving 2,500 LKR for those robbers. We met many vehicles while we are travelling by the tuk including toyota vitz, Noah van, nissan FB 15, nissan caravan. Please share this news with the future travellers. Thanks

Sembuwatte is a man made lake situated in the middle of a tea plantation in the up country. The location reminds you fo European mountain towns and on clear sunny days offers a breathtaking views. Google maps directions are accurate. We took the Wattegama - Elkaduwa road which is  narrow and slightly bumpy buy manageable. The turn off from this road to Sembuwatte Lake is not in good condition. We did see vans at the location but if you do care for your vehicle, we would recommend taking a tuk ;) It cost us LKR 2500 for the return journey. You can park your vehicle on the side of the road near the tuk park. We didn't encounter any harassment from tuk fellows (as mentioned in some reviews) but then again we said yes to first tuk fellow who asked ü§£ There is a ticket counter halfway through the route. Locals have to pay a nominal amount. There was a nice looking restaurant at the site, but they were selling only a few items like roti and plain tea. There were washrooms, but not sure what the conditon was as we didn't use them. The place also had a couple of summer huts where people could have a picnic. The day we went there was a heavy mist and we could barely see the lake..... but still loved the experience. You cannot bath or swim in the lake, but you can take a paddle boat. We also read in reviews that there are other activities like archery and zip lining. Either those items were suspended due to the mist or we simply couldn't see them due to poor visibility. There were couple of leeches, again it may have be due the wet weather on the day we visited. Considering the very bumpy ride upto the lake and the semi bumpy ride from Wattegama, the place is best enjoyed if you spend some considerable time there.....

column8: An incredible place despite the poor road conditions
column11: Sembuwatta Lake is a mesmerizing destination with stunning views. To reach the lake, you'll need to arrange a tuk tuk, but be aware that the road is in poor condition and requires urgent repairs. Despite this, the lake is breathtaking, surrounded by tea gardens all the way to the top. The tuk tuk ride costs $30. The lake itself is beautiful, nestled amidst trees and tea farms, yet it would benefit from more attention and road maintenance.

Sembuwatta Lake in Kandy is a magical destination with breathtaking views and exciting activities like ziplining, paddle boats, and rowboats for two. The only way to get there is by tuk-tuk, and the roads leading to the lake are in need of repair. The tuk-tuk ride costs $30, and the entrance fee is $5.
Visited this beautiful place in May 2024. Unfortunately the day we visited was rainy. Still enjoyed the view. Yhe road to get there needs upgrade. The toilets were in poor condition too.

WHAT A SCAM no signs no info about prices! We arrived at the road to the lake and where stopped by the tuk tuk drivers CLAIMING FALSE things such as the road being to damaged even for a 4 wheel drive Ute!! WE KNEW the scamming had began from the start!! The road to the lake was partly paved and a little bumpy only! When we arrived to the top near the lake WE WHERE STOPPED AGAIN!! This time asking for ungodly amounts of money for a ticket!! 1500 LKR for foreigners and even worse you had to pay extra for photos and videos!! NO WONDER SRI LANKA IS A POOR STRUGGLING ECONOMY!! DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME ON THIS LAKE!! HORRIBLE PEOPLE AND PRICES ALL WANT TO SCAM YOU!! DONT PAY FOR NATURALLY OCCURRING THINGS!!

Arab brothers, beware of scammers in this place This place, as some Ceylonese swindlers claim, is the paradise of the world and that the Prophet Muhammad, peace and blessings be upon him, came to this land. This is empty talk. It was just a person who spread this rumor and declared the paradise of the world and it was circulated by the Ceylonese. The place is beautiful but ultimately artificial When you go to the place, they will tell you that the delivery price is 7,000 rupees per person (approximately 90 Saudi riyals), knowing that a tuk ride for a third of an hour does not cost 2,000 rupees. The way up is very rugged and takes approximately 45 minutes and the same time to get down. In addition to the 1500 rupees you will pay to enter This means that you will pay 8,500 rupees (100 riyals) and you have not entered yet, and this is a large amount on an artificial lake, and they all agree with each other to take advantage of tourists, especially the Gulf ones (note, they charge you a commission when you come from the driver). Secondly, riding in the sea is written 1000 rupees on the sign from the government, and they tell you that it is 5000 rupees, and more than once we have exposed their exploitation, lies and fraud, and if you expose them they mock you in front of the locals, and if you ask the locals they silence them in any way. Therefore, please be careful before going because they are exploitative and consider the Gulf a treasure that came to them There is also a waterfall in the same place and a very cool swimming place The place is nice but it is not worth the amount you pay

Artificial lake with nice scenery and adventure activities. It has a nice foot path around the lake for easy walking. Access road is very narrow and on busy days there definitely will be some non moving traffic jams. also the road is potholed badly, a large sedan wont be able to go without a scratch in the bottom. Best way is to take a tuk. But make sure to negotiate a price before setting a foot in a tuk.
very beautifull and a nice place good for family outs and day trips very recomonded and a must visit place

Sembuwatta Lake is a tourist attraction and site visit. And recently got high popular among local and foreign visitors sightseeing as less touristy sites. Sembuwatta is a beautiful place in the upcountry of Sri Lanka Anyone who wants to have an adventurous experience can spend the day here Everywhere is green and explains the natural beautyüêæüçÉüçÉ
This is very beautiful and nice place. This place is situaedin matale district. A nice place to spend a day with camping. Beautiful and quite calm place to enjoy the nature. Best place for every one.

Sembuwatta Lake is located in the Elkaduwa area in the Matale District of Sri Lanka.  It seems to be a place with many tourist attractions.  A beautiful environment with beautiful views can be seen.  It has a different climate.  Its serene nature will add a different experience to the aesthetic mind.  The destination to Sembuwatta through tea plantations and trees offers a different experience.You can enjoy a variety of activities such as water adventures, swimming pools, motor boat rides, kayak boat rides, adventurous cable and air rifle shooting, and jeep rides. An adventurous cabale passing can give you a truly adventurous fun experience.

Sembuwatta is a man make extremely beautiful lake  . it has got misty and chilly climate.  This lake is surrounded by tea lands & pine trees. Lake situated at Elkaduwa estate in Matale district. There are many beautiful springs on the way. You need a high ground clearance vehicle go there.
Simply waste of time and money,  No proper roads to reach, kind of off road. SLR 250 /= per person. Literately nothing to watch just a late and surround by mountain. Pls do not visit.

Sembuwatta is a man make extremely beautiful lake view on the mountain its elevation of 1140m . it has got misty and chilly climate. Sembuwatta lake is very propuler amoung Local and foreign travelers. This lake is surrounded by tea lands & pine trees. lake situated at elkaduwa in Mathale district. Along side natural spring water pool and you can bath from here. depth of sembuatta lake is 9m to 12m. Not allowed to swim in the lake its very dangerous .
Best place to visit with family and calmful area and lake is very huge and so beautiful also kids enjoyed

Extremely beautiful lake on a high moutaun that you can reach only by Tok Tok ride for 3000 rupies per person. The  way is difficult and not paved with an excellent Hanus waterfall. Not recommended for old people with back problems or heart diseases

Sembuwatta Lake is a tourist attraction and site visit high popular among local and foreign visitors sightseeing as less touristy site. This lake is situated at Elkaduwa area in the Matale District of Sri Lanka. And this is adjacent to the Campbell‚Äôs Lane Forest Reserve and small tea estate with palm trees.Sembuwatta Lake is a man-made lake created from natural spring water. Alongside the lake is a natural swimming pool. A nice place to spend a day. Cool and enchanting environment. Suitable for children too, there is a dedicated swimming fool for them. wedding photographers and the photo lovers will enjoy this place. It‚Äôs worth going through the tough pathway. Wonderful nature scenic place to relax. Those who love nature, be ready for good scenes. beautiful and quite calm place to enjoy the nature. better place for family and kids and friends and also for couples. nice place for wedding photography.

One of our friends suggested this beautiful place so we went there and had a great time. The lake was breathtaking and the cool breeze was amazing. You can walk around rhe whole lake and the uneven and natural foot path make it more adventurous. It will be little difficult if you are carrying small children but my 4 year old enjoyed the walk. The only concern was the road to the entrance which was broken and had so many uneven areas. We were little tired after travelling on that road but the sight of the lake took all the pain away.

I visited here few months back with ma family. Although reaching here is a bit difficult because of the road. You will be amazed as you reach the place. Clearly it is a must visit place. Maintained properly. Hats off to the staff. Can enjoy the zip line adventure üôà.

Quite a beautiful place to visit. Though the lake is man-made, the setting is full of natural beauty. You can walk around the entire lake and this trek is highly recommended. The road leading up to the lake weaves through the Elkaduwa tea estate, and is rugged. Vehicles with low ground clearance struggle at some places along this road. Three wheeled taxis (tuk-tuks) are available at the base of the road and charge around Rs. 1,200 for a round trip (with waiting for about an hour). I'd recommend taking this option considering, 1) No stress on navigating the rugged road (progress was very slow for some cars we met on the way), 2) No vehicle wear and tear, 3) The tuk tuk trip is actually good fun. Good place to visit if you have some time to spare when you are around Kandy/Matale.

The Lake and nature is amazing . if you need some great clicks of nature , I recommed here to have shoot .it's surely give a pleasure . Another thing is it's hard to travel with normal cars , Road is hardly damaged one and tuk tuk drivers are big scammers . they cheat you nicely . Paying for entrance is essential . less in sanitary facilities  .I don't recommend to have events there . Just for visit there and engage with rich nature

We had a visit to sembuwaththa lake few months back and I did not expect such beauty over there. An ideal place for a preshoot I suppose. I loved the misty environment it was bit raining so it was amazing. You could go around the lake underneath huge trees.  The only point to consider is the road it was not good at all and you may find it difficult to drive if you are travelling by a car. It is recommend to use a better vehicle. And again please make sure not to pollute the area

We visited this lake during a road trip from Sigiriya to Ella, though it‚Äôs known to be visited when you are spending sometime in/ around Kandy. Generally speaking, it is a tough ride, especially if you have an elderly with you. Make sure the driver has visited this place before because the road needs to indeed be mastered. You would think that a lake would be near the surface, but not this one. It is 1,074m elevated above the surface. We had a 4-wheel buss, but we stopped before we reached the place by 25 mins and got there by a tuktuk (you must bargain the prices well, we payed 2,000LKR). Though when we reached there, we found a couple of busses, so it is doable. I would advise you spend the sometime their, so prepare yourself as if you are going to a picnic. There are cottage-like seating area that you can use.

Really exiting place. Road to the place is not good for modern motor cars. It is not problem for Jeeps & Double Cabs. If you travel in a modern car, please park your car on the way and take a Tuk-Tuk (Three wheeler). Lot of Tuk-Tuks are available for this purpose. This place has facilities for night-outs. They provide accommodation with a cook. Need to book in advance. Contact site office for more information.

So it‚Äôs on the spot travel in Matale and we decided to go to Sembuwaththa Lake together with family and young children. It was so amazing, that in the top of the mountain there is this amazing Lake, Tea plantation, Pine trees and so many more. They also have this fresh water pool both adults and children. It was so amazing that we don‚Äôt want to go back down. And for all, they also have zip-line which I ride two times üòÇ and also boat ride and jet-sky were many tourist enjoy. Most recommended!!! Hope to come again

What a stunning place, fabulous and wonderful landscape. There are variety of plantations around the lake and there is even a forest. In the way to the lake you will find other plantations like tea, pepper, cinnamon.... etc. Most visitors of this site are Arabs, so if you are an Arab you will feel home and you will even find an Arab restaurant in the way to lake, or even more, you can find some tuktuk drivers who knows how to cook Arab food and eat it by the lake. The only cons is tuktuk prices, it is too overpriced.

Watch out as there are a group of tuktuk before arriving to the lake that charges really a lot of money (around 40-50 USD). When we negotiated the price to 20 USD then they claimed that we have to pay the lake entrace tickets, which they first said that it is included with the tuktuk price. As part of the deal they took us to the waterfall which dry and a real joke. They should tell people and make them pay to show a dry waterfall. Bad experience check well before you go.

The scenery was great. It's a place you must visit. But service sucks. We were at the entrance at 6.00 am and had to wait about 2 hrs to get the tickets cuz he had gone home. Ticket was 200lkr and only valid for 4hours. If you stay the night, its 1000lkr.
Sembuwatta Lake is a man-made lake created from natural spring water. Alongside the lake is a natural swimming pool. Sembuwatta Lake is believed to be 9 m (30 ft.) to 12 m (39 ft.) deep.

Sembuwatta Lake is a man made lake in the middle of a tea plantation. Good place for half a day hangout. Beautiful scenery around the lake, boat trips available. Spring water pool for a bath, but water is quite cold. Path to the location is through difficult terrain, 4WD preferable.
Sembuwaththa lake and surrounding aria is rich in natural wonder. tea plantations and mountains in surrounding aria
I like the place very beautiful place wonderful games available cabling,boat rides, swan ride and swimming pool etc

Its a must see attraction settled deep in the Elkaduwa estate. Mastermind behind this creation is Mr.Radley Disage, Manager of the Elkaduwa estate.A lot of recreational outdoor activities such as the Zip line, boat rowing, bathing in the natural pool...etc are available. The road to the lake is a very jagged road but three wheelers provide transportation. Sembuwaththa lake gets its name from an incident in the past where a golden "Sembuwa" (a type of pot) was found by a hermit. "Waththa" means the forest in Sinhala.

After a not so easy rough ride to a top of a mountain, you will see this beautiful place..! Not yet polluted by human activities, though it is a man made lake. A fascinating site and a must visit if you are planning to spend time around Kandy.

A man made lake in elkaduwa estate. It‚Äôs developed to be a major tourist attraction. A huge crowd is seen throughout the day specially on weekends. Nice place to enjoy an evening. There are some activities to do like zip line, boat rides. Some huts are there which you can use to have your food or even to prepare them. Entrance fee is 200 rupees. Access road is pretty tough but doable with any vehicle if you drive carefully. Don‚Äôt fall for tuk tuk drivers who warn you that it‚Äôs not doable and ask you to hire them. Final 300m is tougher. If you want you can park your vehicle near tea factory and walk this final stretch. Also tuk tuks available here as well which charge you 200 rupees to go to top.

This is a place where you can enjoy with your family while you are spending the time with your loved ones. You can even cook your own meal by bringing the necessary goods. It has a spectacular view. Route to get there is bit tough but never the less it is worth.
This is an ideal place to spend the day, surrounded with lush green and blue water.Stunning activities will keep you and the kids busy throughout the day.

Nice place to walk around and have fun with friends and family - It is a long journey - but you can drive to the top. Last few kilometers - the road is not that good - and you need to drive carefully- They have ziplilning and things as well.
I always recomend to you that is a very beautiful place for to you all.very chilling place with lot of activities with boat ride also.
It's really worth to visit there , but journey is little bit difficult but end result with over with very nice views , you will have stunning views over there. Amazing

I decided not to visit this place until they construct the road. My vehicle damaged badly.... believe or not one case is dust in AC. I recommend only 4wd vehicles or your foot only if you are so dust resisted. With the current condition I do not recommend if you are fun loving. I am trully disappointment with road. And no place for refreshments. If you want anything you have to carry what you need all the way from where you started the journey. Or you can take a cooker and cook leaving your holiday to the devil.

The road leading to the lake takes a little time along the curves and bumps in the middle of the tea estate. Once arrived at the mid station the usual tickets have to be purchased at the counter. Rudeness is tradition in Sri Lanka at entrance gates. Another load of curves to arrive at the lake. Note that regular vehicles may not be able to pass due to difficult road conditions. Once on top, you can enjoy panoramic and scenic views and breath fresh and pure air. The place offers different attractions for all, walking, swimming, boat rides, covered picnic spaces, etc. You can enjoy a full day if you organise food or just an hour or two to enjoy the surroundings. NB: toilets at the entrance gate are clean. Take a little jumper in case of uncertain weather as it can be cool.

We‚Äôve in this so called heaven lake. It was a magnificent place and very nice weather. The entry fee was 1000rs/person. U can bring your things and do BbQ if you want. Also, there is boat tour in the lake but the tuk tuk drivers warned us about it. They said something about electricity ( couldn‚Äôt understand them well). The lake is a worth visiting place but the tuk tuk drivers who took you from the waterfall to the lake are trying their best to drain your money! We are family of 5 so we will need 2 tuktuks to get there. We‚Äôve been told it‚Äôs 6000rs for 1 tuktuk. So 2 for 12000rs -nonsense!!-. I googled immediately and found out the prices to be around 1000-1500rs for 1 tuktuk normally. I tried to barging but the best i got is 4000rs. All tuktuk drivers are working together in same ‚Äúnetwork‚Äù under control of 1 person ( i forgot his name). I agreed to the price even though i knew I‚Äôve been robbed. These sri lankan people are ruining and destroying the tourism in their country with thia behavior. Don‚Äôt forget to visit the nearby waterfall (forgot its name but it‚Äôs hard to miss it, the entry fee is so small)

We started our journey from Kandy. (around 9.00am) our root was Kandy to Wattegama via Katugasthota , from Wattegeama you have to take the Elkaduwa root. from Elkaduwa it is only 2 1/2km to Sembuwatte Estate. We went on a bike. A jeep, a 4*4 vehicle, can easily get through this narrow roots up to the hill. this is one of the best places that you can find in up country. The weather is gloomy but the feeling is enough fill your lungs with cool and fresh air. In sembuwatte you can visit the Estate factory (need an special authorization to get there), Sembuatte estate, and the lake which adds the most scenic view to the whole estate. you can ride a boat around the lake, and there are many more entertaining activities that you can enjoy. Sembuwatte lake situated on the top of the estate and surrounded with pines and tea plants which makes the whole estate an awesome place. you don't need a guide, just follow gps you can find your way to this hidden heaven. I prefer you to bring some snacks on your own as there are only few small tuck shops in Sembuwatte. they have toiletry facilities which is in good condition, as well as relaxing tents for you to sit and enjoy the real beauty of Sri Lanka. they require to buy tickets for every person. In the weekends there will be many locals. so choose your visit wisely. A must see place.

This place hideaway from Matale town. also its bit difficult to get to this place as the roads are not well maintained you need a 4X4 or a higher vehicle to travel to this place easily but however other vehicles can also travel and its on your own risk.Its a artificial man made lake between tea plantations and pine forest good entertainment location for all age.

Many just visit thinking it has some religious relevance and spoil the place. No god lives there. Hardly any nature lover to be seen. Too  many vehicles are allowed inside. Very less respect shown towards the nature.
Nice place..... Not polluted yet..... Lots of fun activities... But you have to take your meals...no restaurants to buy food . Road to the place is tough.. But thrilling

Nice place to visit. But the road to Sembuwaththa needs improvents. Can go by car or even by tuk tuk. One and half drive from Matale. Took time due to poor roads and the drive was slow. It's a human made lake with few attractions. You need to buy tickets to enter this premises. And it was 200 for me since I'm a local. Leaches are not a stranger to this location so better to apply some balm  before you start your walk in the nature.

This place is breath taking, I have been here twice. Best time is early morning to walk through the mist as if walking through the clouds on water. Not forgetting you've get some fun activities as well. like boat Kayaking 300LKR, Swan boat ride 500LKR, Zip line 300LKR which makes it much more interesting. Entrance fee: 200 LKR I really enjoyed trekking along the tea plantations and through the pine trees. its well maintained and clean. If you are planning to make a visit please do not litter the area. Must say about conditions of the roads, it is very tricky. best way to get here is by a van which has a good road clearance. you will have to leave the vehicle near the plantation factory and trek the path to the Lake or you could take the vehicle towards the lake side as well. they've a special area for a vehicle park. you will find a small boutique to buy tea etc... My advice is to take your own food, be it a spend the day or a spend the night over. Make it day of picnic, you get some huts over looking the lake. Just relax and enjoy. Also accommodation is available on site. you need to call them up for early reservations, they've the Polo Bungalow which is 15000LKR for a group of 12. The Summer huts, kinda tree house 1000LKR per person in a group of 10 (less than 10 - 7500LKR) I would like to stay up here at a summer hut and have BBQ night the next time I visit :) This place has restrooms, but do take your sanitizes... This place is for family, friends and couples. Fabulous location for tourism. awesome for photography... ! Finally special packages can arranged for solo ladies, families interested in visiting this place and you need support in transport or tour guiding please contact: 0750797356 "Cheers"

This place is situated long away from Matale town and long journey too. We made it there just to explore the place but It's better if you head directly to Riverston skipping this place if you have a limited days to spend. The place is good and small. Has a lake and some area to walk around. Good for a dayout.
it is great to be there. the area of the lake and the experience in the hill country was fabulous . expecting to travel again. thank you for your kind considerations and support.

It is a beautiful place resembles heaven on earth. I think it is better for you to have your own food. You can enjoy with your family with no interruptions. Wash room facility has to be improved. Also the bathing tank which is near lake is so dirty, need to clean that and need have some rules for the users not to use it in a improper manner with improper clothing. Need improvement in road conditions also. However it is a great place to visit.

Definitely a must-see during a trip in Sri Lanka. You have to take a local tuk-tuk for a hour ride way and back through sneaky and gritty paths. Lake is located among the tea fields and a forests of high and skinny trees like the one in some states in America! Place is clean, quiet and large to enjoy taking picture, silent and have a walk. Place has washrooms and large huts overlooking the forest on a side and the lake on the other side. You can rent little boats to ride on the lake. In case of rain, place provides umbrellas. Dress code would be like chill, sport and casual. Fee is Rs. 1000 per adult Great spot for picnic, meditation and lecture! I highly recommend this place for solo, family, friends or couples! Enjoy my Epicureans!

Sembuwatta Lake is really an amazingly beautiful landscape. It is situated on Elkaduwa, Matale. Even though it is a man-made reservoir, you never be able say that by looking at it. I my self admired it very much. There are activities you can take part also like, boat rides, shooting, zip lining etc. You are even allowed to prepare your meals (and eat them) there. But make sure to keep the place tidy for all others to enjoy. Further, they rent the place for 'Out Bound Training' and 'Camping' also. There is an entry fee for both locals and foreigners.
It is not a natural lake but man made one, but beautiful surroundings, when mist comes down place is more beautiful,  you can participate some activities such as bort riding,
Nice place to spend a day and boat ride also there, mountains covered lake, Recommended to bring foods or you can make there your own food like BBQ with your tools

Once of the most beautiful places in Sri Lanka. The specialty of this place is, this is not 100% natural lake. This place was golf ground sometimes ago & the management of Elkaduwa Tea Estate, converted this place to a nice lake (man-made lake created from natural spring water). It‚Äôs very rear to find a place in Sri Lanka with all the facilities at one place. It‚Äôs a Leisure Park with beautiful sceneries, lots of leisure activities and facilities. You can walk right around it. There are huts (with electricity) where you can eat your meal, watch the sunset, or just relax. Swimming pool with natural spring water is there surrounded by the tea estate. The water is clean because it is continuously been replaced. If you look carefully, you will also see beautiful birds singing on the treetops on the way. The road leading to Sembuwatta was extremely hard, the road was getting narrow and it had too many difficult bends to take.

You have to rent a small toktok since no car allowed to enter the narrow road. You can bring sandwiches or soft drinks to make it enjoyable journey. The tickets cost 1000 rb and extra 300 for the lake. There are many stops for drinks , rest room. Total journey time for me to vist both about 6 hours.

The Exotic lake at the edge of the remote town of Elkaduwa.  We use to travel to this place more frequently when we are in Sri Lanka. It was an amazing place with breathtaking views of the lake and tea plantation. When your planning a trip to Sembuwatta you should re think of the medium which you are going to travel, Please do not choose saloon or sedan cars. You should travel in a 4x4, Van or Tuk Tuk why because the roads are very narrow and some times when its raining it becomes muddy. So dont speed up only one vehicle can go at a time. If your travelling with kids please take Jackets mostly it will be misty the climate will frequently change. Also consider taking Snaks, Water and consumables as per your need. Must watch location once in a life time. Highly Recommended!

The road leading to Sembuwatta was extremely hard so do reconsider if you are going in a big, long bus / coach. Once there, we purchased a ticket Rs 200 per person. From that point we had to walk through the tea estate. Alternatively you can take a trishaw. We opted to walk and it was fun. Once up there the scenery was breath taking. In my view, the ideal time to reach the lake is around 3pm (they close at 6pm) so you can be there for the sunset. We walked half way across the lake upto the natural pool....do not plan to bath in that, the water looked extremely dirty. If you are going on a rainy day, take special care about leaches. There were many near the water. A local told us that there was a bunglow / camp site to rent if you prefer to spend the night. There was a notice saying for Rs 10,000 per person overnight stay could be arranged. We didn't explore the options as we were put off by the leaches and we had kids in the party. Just like any attraction in SL, toilets were wet. At least there was ample of water.....to flush and clean. Nice to visit with a group and enjoy the sunset.

One of the most favourite place in Sri Lanka. It's bit far from city but filled nature. The surrounding of the lake was just amazing. They doesn't have any hotels, but lot of cottages, we can do self cooking and hangout for whole day. The maintenance was simply awesome. No noise, no population simply peace will chilled breeze.

After seen the pictures, i thought this is a great placed to be at. But it was not the case when i visited over there. Only good thing about is the beautiful lush green view  and other than that its a horrible place. The road heading up to the  Sembuwathatha lake is a terrible. Make sure you travel in a car/jeep with good ground clearance. If you are planing to go by a Japanese Car then it will be a extremely difficult dive due to the low ground clearance. Furthermore road is extremely narrow and not enough space for two vehicles. Things will get really messed up if there are so many reckless three wheel (tuk tuk) drivers. Those drivers never give the space to cross vehicles. Please note that there are tuk tuk drivers at the junction which starts the road to Sembuwaththa lake and they will say that your vehical cannot get there because of low ground clearance. Dont listen to them, they are trying to reap your money. Talk to anyone who is coming back from the lake and ask whether its possible to drive your car. This place is over crowed and you cannot enjoy the nature. This is not  a calm and quiet place. No toilet facilities or to have good food. Management charge for Rs 200/= per person but no facilities are provided.  Note that there are lot of tuk tuk drivers who are doing business over there and you cannot spend your time leisurely

Attractive plc to visit..its bettr if u cn visit in d morning.bz u cn spend ur whole day on hill n thr s small pool to swim. Road is quite difficult.dnt go in d evening..bz u hv to face traffic jam(road is narrow n difficult to cross two vehicles) n it closes at 6pm..

Admit that it's a very nice location. But not very impressed with maintenance of the place specially with the sanitary service. For the amount that they charge it's not well maintained at all. Feel like it's ripping off the visitors. Not going to recommend to anyone unless they improve on their road service and sanitary service.

Sembuwatta lake is an artificially created lake at the top of a hill.We were amazed by the panoramic view when we reached the top. It really relaxed our minds. The location is ideal for photography and we could take some nice photos. Though the road was bit 'adventurous'(than that in Ambuluwawa bio diversity complex), you can still  reach the top by car. We hired a trishaw and we did not regret the decision when we were reaching the top!

Family friendly day-out spot near elkaduwa. clean environment. Beautiful lake. Bit crowded pool. You can enjoy with boat ride and outdoor family time. Entrance for local LKR200. BBQ facilities available. Nice calm place to spend the time. Parking available.
Beautiful place to spend time with your loved once, specially for photos. Silent place and it's wind give you much more pleasure.
Rs. 200 for entry was taken. Nice place for a day out. Do not try swimming in the lake. They do have a pool area for swimming separately.
Nice mother nature.its very beautiful place in matale district near to famous city kandy.if some one need to any assist further i can help u to travel with safe
Good for family outing to enjoy the nature and lust green ghats of Srilanka. Close to Kanday - can reach by car üöó

Apparently this is a little secret not many drivers or people know about but wow, it's so beautiful it really is a place I'd love to live die get married be reincarnated become a river fairy you name it, it's a must see, bucket list it's lovely Sunil took me there and he's one of the longest serving tuk tuk drivers on the circuit he's usually parked near Kandy lake near the little bridge and you can trust him his cards in pics
This is a very beautiful place. If you go to Matale, do not forget to visit this place. Worth it. But be ready to have a bath in the natural pool.

This a a man made small lake surrounded by mountains and pine forest. Location is scenic but there is lot of dust in the surrounding. Also it is over crowded and noisy with people who come for day outing. There isn't much nature to enjoy. The road leading to this place is not well maintained and very dusty. I assume it's not worth visiting this place if you want to enjoy the natural beauty in a peaceful environment.

This is very beautiful and calm location. Middle there's a large lake surrounded by a tea plantation. Road is bit rocky and bit hard to reach through vehicles but of course you can drive through the path.. There's a separate parking area at the location. The view is amazing and cool breeze will give you a heavenly comfort.

Sembuwattha is a beautiful natural pond where you can spend your day taking pictures. But the day we visited was over crowded.  It was so difficult to find a place to sit. Natural pool was crowded with adult guys. So we hardly found one place to take our lunch then took sime pics and came back. As our team was big with kids we had to use a bigger bus and it was so scaring to travel in a big bus when they show you the place where there was a huge fatal accident in 2015. However at the ticket counters (1 ticket for elders was Rs. 200) we had to stop our bus and had to hire tuk tuks. (Each Rs. 200) So I strongly recommend you to use a small vehicle.
Amazing view. One of the best place I have ever visit. Cool air surrounded by full of trees. can have a cool bath from the pool near to the lake. Ideal for family gatherings, night camping lovers.

Having read a few reviews and recommendations from the locals we went to this lake thinking it will be a quite sanctuary where there will be beautiful scenery and peace and quite Beautiful scenery was abundant However the route to the location was horrendous a very narrow road and so many vehicles , if you don't have a sound vehicle and driver then I would recommend getting one prior to the trip Once you arrive there it is obvious the place is a hit with the locals I didn't see many foreigners at all only one couple There is a entrance fee per person I believe for locals it is Rs 200 Once you enter you may walk around the lake but be careful not to be hit by the tuck-tucks which drive as if they have been possessed by Micheal Schumacher :) Road traffic rules are out of he window !! So your safety is in your hands We also went on a boat ride the only boat available is run by a few locals and they don't seem to adhere to any Heath and safety procedures A lot of people seem to get injured while getting into the boat !! The rates are not clear for the ride and they seem to charge different rates to different people . They were also racist fortunately not to us but to others there seem to be some sort of dislike towards the Muslims and the concern care was abundant to the Buddhists who are the majority This really put me off ! Apart form this it is a clean environment There is also a man made pool within the vicinity for children and adults to enjoy

This is a Lake in Matale city, near Alkaduwa area. You have to have a vehicle to go there since there are no buses to the estate. You have to buy an ticket to entrance the estate.This lake is a ancient lake with many more stories around it and dangerous to swim or bath. There is a Swimming Pool just next to the Lake where you can cool down your body temperature with ice cold water. There are Small huts around the lake to have your meals and snaks. It's Very hard to find shops near Lake area, so its good to brought food from outside. Beautiful scenery. Best place to chill out with family or friends. Suitable for parties.

Very nice place to have a good family time... If it's too crowded then it's a bit hard to enjoy... Other than that nice place. Lunch should be brought from outside if not it's very hard to Find a good place to eat nearby.
This is by far the most beautiful place I have visited in Sri Lanka. Breathtaking view and Soothing weather.
It was a super duper place to visit with your families and chill. Pool was ice cool, so you can having a ice bath free.

It's a marvel of nature. Although its man made lake surroundings are astonishing. Next to lake you will find a small swimming pool safe for bathing. Water is Crystal clear with lots of fish life. Bating is allowed. Best is listen to nature.
Amazing place Worth 5000 rupees (for tuk tuk and entrance tickets for couple) One of the best places i have ever visited

Sembuwatta Lake is a man-made lake created from natural spring water. Alongside the lake is a natural swimming pool. Sembuwatta Lake is believed to be 9 m (30 ft) to 12 m (39 ft) deep. Currently the lake belongs to the Elkaduwa Plantations and produces electricity for the nearby villagers.

It is a man made lake surrounded by tea plantation. The location is at its best when the visitors are less. They charge 200LKR per head to enter the premises and seems they improve / maintain the standard accordingly. They are offering overnight reservation of the place and that might be a goo experience. Access road from Elkaduwa is narrow. Road condition is bad for the last 4 kilometers but can't say worst. They were doing some work to improve the road quality when i last visited on Mid September, 2016.

Well....this is man made nice place but I think this place is overrated. Pictures of this place looks amazing......it may be due to capability of photographer and photogenisity of this place but for naked eye it is not that beautiful.

This hidden beauty place gives you to enjoy hill country's nature. it's located near Hunnas falls hotel and ideal for family day out. It's hard to get to this place due the bad road. Bit difficult to reach by Weight car but smooth for 4x4. Also you can upgrade your off road drive experience and nature photography skills. You will be charged LKR 200/- per head. Tuk tuk's are available, if you do not wish to go the end by your vehicle. Kids park and swimming pool available for kids and adults. There are several places available for accommodation with A/C and non A/C rooms. Love travel. Love nature.

this is  tourist attraction point situated at Elkaduwa in the Matale District of Sri Lanka, adjacent to the Campbell‚Äôs Lane Forest Reserve. Sembuwatta Lake is a man-made lake created from natural spring water. Alongside the lake is a natural swimming pool. Sembuwatta Lake is believed to be 9 m (30 ft) to 12 m (39 ft) deep. Currently the lake belongs to the Elkaduwa Plantations and produces electricity for the nearby villagers.

I have been traveling many places in Sri Lanka. I love my mother nature very much, This place is not a natural place to enjoy there are so many places to visit around Kandy area where we can enjoy it free. bad roads, high cost, no foods, maintenance crew is not supportive and its bad Satisfaction. (i heard that it has marketed as a Muslim religious place that can not be true)   Don't waste your money and time visit another place this is really true. Hope you will not be a stupid as me.

We've been there last week. The place was such an amazing, calm.and cool. They charge per person LKR. 200.00 which is nearly USD 1.5. They need your Passport or National ID. The road was very bad condition, I saw some repairing was going on. I've been with my friends, my next visit with my family. I love Sembuwaththa lake.
ideal for half day picnic. better carry your food and drinks. excellent place to walk around and relax and meditate.
Best place to enjoy nature and the beauty of the environment Take snacks with you to eat because there are no shops near the lake. views are very nice from all the sides of the lake

We heard Sembuwatta is a place of worth visit and we traveled there just after Sinhalese Aurudu. Condition of the road is terrible and dangerous. Fully crowded and natural pool is not clean at all. They charged LKR 200 as a local entrance fee which is not worth. But the views are amazing that is the only thing that I could recommend. Think twice if anyone think to go there.
just wow and very relaxing place. buy it's not good place for kids as you will walk a lot so the children will be very tired no bathroom very bad bathroom
An interesting reservoir created by kings of the past.  Beautifully surrounded by nature and some small ruins.  Worth 30 mins or an hour of your time to view and walk around.

It's hard to get to this place due the bad road but it's worth going specially during sunset, we sat camp overnight. Clean place, you can have a lunch there but don't go during the weekend a lot of local around and some guys drink around that area. Overall I recommend this place and I strongly recommend to clime up the tea plantation hell and enjoy the view

The lake is on top of mountain and view is nice. you can have a boat ride with additional cost. There is an entrancw fee, because the property is a private one. The road condition is not that good. So better to use your friends vehicle.

For a brief moment; I thought I was in Switzerland!!!! Stunning location, that please your eyes, over and over again!!!!! They have two different areas, for drinking crowds and families. Which I feel; is a good idea.

Read the reviews on trip advisor before finalizing our day trip.. The drive was smooth and not as bad as we thought. Thankfully, it was a lovely sunny day... Not advisable on rainy days as drive will be difficult.. Once you reach the place, you'll never want to go back.. Lots to do for any kind of travelers.. Couples, friends and families.. Take everything you might need as there's only a small shop close by which sells water, soft drinks, biscuits.. All in all, a must on your diary if you visit Kandy or Matale. Check the weather before you travel...

I've bn to lake district I  United kingdom,so I name this place LAKE DISTRICT OF SRI LANKA..path to Sembuwatta is undeveloped and hard to reach their bit that's the plus point which gives crunchy feel to journey...once you reached the top you 4gt old the hardship u passed on ...mind soothing place

It was a very nice place with breath taking views. the road is a bit hard to travel and you have to go all the way up the mountains, but the result is worth the effort and magnificent natural beauty. a must go when travelling Mathale

It is situated about 25-30 km away from kandy city. You will need a 4 X 4 vehicle or a vehicle with good ground clearance. Our visit was with motor bikes. Ticket prices were very high. Best time is to visit is early morning and crowded in weekends.

The lake is situated at Elkauwa Tea Estate, near Hunnas falls hotel. The road is narrow   but the repairs are under way.can go by car or tuk- tuk. About 10 acher lake is unbelievable in such altitude. this was originally built to get hydro power the tea factory at the entrance. Have to take your stuff as no boutique nearby. If you want to stay near lake you can book Polo Bungalow which is also managed by Elkaduwa [Sembuwatta] estate.(3BR bungalow with cook for 15000/- rupees)

it is a sunny day when we left from Kandy to visit the 'Sembuwatta'. we had read little about this place and our guide also recomended this place as a nice place to visit. it was about one hour drive by car from Kandy and then half hour tuk tuk ride. when we reached Sembuwatta we realized as it is a place that every tourist must visit.it is a location second just to the heaven.so beautiful with the lake and sorounded nature. we spent there for about 3 hours and left  but we wanted to stay whole day as we had only one day in Kandy and had to visit other places. in clear words 'Sembuwatta is a Paradise'.

This is a lake situated at higher elevation. the road is narrow and it is good if you can take 4x4 . the view is splendid once you climb up the mountain. there is mini pool where you can have a bathe with fresh water.

Sembuwatte lake is about 20 KM away from the city. After a rough one hour drive from kandy we reached sembuwatte estate without a single scratch. Road was narrow till the top. But we travelled their by our vehicle. Tuk tuk's were available if you do not wish to go the distance by your vehicle. Price from half way to the top and comeback in a tuk tuk is 1500 LKR. They go fast and easy on narrow roads. And the entrance fee for a local is 200LKR while they charge 1000LKR from a foreigner. The scenary was amazing on the top. A beautiful lake surrounded by pines trees, mountains and tea plants. Few manmade huts were availble around the lake. If you are going to spend the day, you should bring food and water since there was no shop nearby. And please do not litter this beautiful place. There was a pool on the top. It was under construction at the time we visited. All in all, we managed to spend a day in a beautiful environment.

This is a hidden beautiful place in Sri Lanka.. good for a day out with your loved once and friends... Places is bit crowed in weekend and school days as many of them has got to know the place... Its a good place for hiking if you in Hunnas Falls Hotel... You will find many picturesque natural beauty in this area..

It is a very nice eye catching place surrounded by some beautiful tea and pine plantations. I felt so relaxed because of the quietness and the beauty of nature I was experiencing. I mostly enjoyed the cold and fresh wind came through the hill. There are a pool and a park for kinds to play. Food for a family trip or for couples. However, the road to Sembuwaththa is very bad. You'll have to drive carefully!

I visit This pace with my wife coz we saw pics of this place from facebook. It's really nice view good for photos. This place even good for pikniks. Road to visit this place is really bad and road signs are bad too. since this has many mountain most probably GPS signals also poor If you are planing to visit this place first study road from google map before you visit.

This is one of the most beautiful tea eastate places i've been to. It's so relaxing, you can actually spend the whole day just staring at this lovely scenaries.. The day we went, the climet was perfect and each side of the lake gives a diffent experience. Once you are here, make sure to have a walk around the lake and it's area. This could be just 3hours trip or could be a whole day -- depends on your liking ;) *just make sure you take your own food, as they don't have a place to buy food and DO NOT LEAVE YOUR GARBAGE!* It takes about an hour to 1 and half hours to reach here from Kandy city, so have a pre-plan. Skip bathing from the pool they have built (lake is not allowed for bathing) and with permission, you can even do one-night camping! The silence and the calmness this place offers, is a true blessing!
Very beautiful place, entrance fee Rs 200 per person. Roads are terrible and extremely dangerous. Our vehicle almost toppled.

Easy to go from kandy city.the road is with bends.by the road can get fresh and good banana s. The lake and tea estates are eye Catching place s. The entrench fee is 1000 Rs..just good to walk around the lake. Boat rides are also too much
I'm surprised this is a really quite place to relax your mind.... The silence of nature is very real it surrounds you,You can feel it...
It is quite far by tuk tuk from Kandy and the road is very bumpy but worth the visit! Bring a picnic and enjoy the relaxed atmosphere and the beautiful tea plantation.

When I visited my sisters in Kandy it's they who came up with the idea of visiting "sembuwaththa" lake.We started the journey at around nine o' clock. We went via waththega.The road was not that good yet there were some attempts to keep it maintained. It was nice to be there since that place was surrounded by hills and we were isolated among the hills giving us a chance to be in a calm silent atmosphere. Many foreign visitors were experiencing the thril. Smhsp
